results.content: Le cours n'est pas mis a jours depuis la version 1.4 de Auth0, ce qui creer des conflits, et du debug permanent, de plus les explication sont trop légère, j'ai choisi cette formation pour prisma 2.0 : le back end, j'ai voulu finir cette formation avec le front end, la deuxième partie. Les choses se sont compliquées, debug permanent, perte de temps, et incompréhension de certains bug, du au manque d'explication, et de l'integration de auth0 < 1.0 (version du cours) quand la version actuelle est 1.5, je ne recommande pas la partie front end de la formation, ça va trop vite, c'est pas clair, c'est lourd. les explications du back end : graphql / prisma m'ont suffit mais .. toujours très leger

Les choses se sont compliquées, debug permanent, perte de temps, et incompréhension de certains bug, du au manque d'explication, et de l'integration de auth0 < 1.0 (version du cours) quand la version actuelle est 1.5, je ne recommande pas la partie front end de la formation, ça va trop vite, c'est pas clair, c'est lourd. les explications du back end : graphql / prisma m'ont suffit mais .. toujours très leger

results.content: Great Courses for latest modern tools technology for web development so far

results.content:
Certainly the most useful Udemy project i've seen so far and a great explanation of how it all works. 

Would have like to have had more background lectures on Apollo and Prisma. Aside from standing them up, I don't feel like I learned much more than when I started.

results.content:
Awesome course. I have little experience with GraphQL so this is not a begginers course. 

Given the videos are long it might be a difficult to follow, but in overall I believe it's a good one.

I hope Stephen continue creating more advance react courses.

results.content:
This is hard to recommend: On one hand, the instructor communicates clearly and knows what he's talking about. On the other, I ran into two big strikes right away:

- There's a lot of coding in split-screen, so code examples aren't clear. While there is a GitHub repo, it's a pretty poor student experience to have to keep referring to that because of blurry/tiny code examples.

- The Postgres db creation part of the course is completely handwaved in the videos, and that skillset isn't mentioned at all in the prerequisites of the course. In fairness to the instructor, this is something that Prisma makes difficult, you can't just spin up a heroku-postgres instance and call it a day, but it can be a heavy lift from somebody who isn't very comfortable with setting up databases.
